summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019. The sheets are for specific tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) and record staff observations of inmates in continuous locked-down status, following a protocol requiring checks at least twice per hour. The sheets were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.

persons.context: The senior officer who, along with the Lieutenant, reviewed the completed check sheets.

events.title: Routine Inmate Monitoring in MCC SHU
events.description: Standard 30-minute observational checks were conducted on inmates held in the Special Housing Unit under continuous locked-down status (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison check sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 10, 2019.
It details a strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are divided by watch (Morning, Day, Evening) and specific tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) within the SHU.
Each sheet was reviewed and signed off by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
The document represents standard correctional facility procedure for monitoring high-security or segregated inmates.
